summary: This Applegate Uncured Beef Hot Dog is made with organic grass-fed beef and contains organic spices, but also includes celery powder, which can be a source of nitrates. The hot dog is high in fat and very low in carbohydrates and sodium.

moderate_risk.name: Celery Powder
moderate_risk.concerns: Can be a source of naturally occurring nitrates which convert to nitrites during processing.  Excessive nitrite consumption is associated with potential health risks [1].

Celery Powder.title: Celery Powder â€“ Additive
Celery Powder.summary: Celery powder is a natural source of nitrates used as a preservative and flavoring agent in processed meats. It provides a source of nitrates that, when converted to nitrites during processing, can contribute to the curing and preservation of meat products. This conversion can potentially lead to the formation of nitrosamines, which are carcinogenic compounds [2].
health_concerns: May contribute to the formation of nitrosamines, potentially increasing cancer risk [2].
High nitrate/nitrite intake may impact thyroid function [3].
Celery Powder.common_uses: Used in processed meats like hot dogs, sausages, and bacon as a natural curing agent.

citations.1: EFSA Panel on Food Additives and Nutrient Sources added to Food (ANS). (2017). Scientific Opinion on the re-evaluation of sodium nitrite (E 250) and potassium nitrite (E 249) as food additives. *EFSA Journal*, *14*(6), 4477.
citations.2: Tricker, A. R. (1997). N-Nitroso compounds and human cancer: A review of epidemiological evidence. *Mutation Research/Fundamental and Molecular Mechanisms of Mutagenesis*, *381*(1), 141-159.
citations.3: Iodide in thyroid disease. (2023). *National Institute of Diabetes and Digestive and Kidney Diseases*. https://www.niddk.nih.gov/health-information/endocrine-diseases/iodine-deficiency

recommendations.name: BBQ Beef Jerky
recommendations.summary: This beef jerky has a Green risk rating and contains no artificial preservatives or nitrates, making it a potentially healthier alternative. It also provides a higher protein content per serving.

recommendations.name: Aberdeen angus beef
recommendations.summary: This Aberdeen Angus beef has a Green risk rating and may contain less preservatives than hotdogs, making it a potentially healthier alternative. It also provides a higher protein content per serving.

recommendations.name: Ground Beef Burgers
recommendations.summary: These ground beef burgers has a Yellow risk rating, simple ingredients and is likely less processed than a hot dog. It provides a source of protein with no added ingredients beyond beef.

recommendations.name: Top Round Beef
recommendations.summary: This Top Round Beef has a Yellow risk rating, simple ingredients and is likely less processed than a hot dog. It provides a source of protein with minimal additional ingredients.
